intro: Sticherus aurantiacus, commonly known as the orange-stemmed sticherus, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, yellowish-orange stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Sticherus aurantiacus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
